articles.description: When Harry Kane was on the pitch, Bayern Munich were heading to the Champions League final at Wembley. When he wasn't there, it all went wrong.
articles.title: Harry Kane: Thomas Tuchel blames striker's back pain for Bayern Munich substitution

articles.description: It is sport's most decisive and divisive moment - but what is it like to deliver a knockout punch, and to take one?
articles.title: Knockout: Ricky Hatton, David Haye, Tony Bellew and more talk KOs

articles.description: Bayern Munich manager Thomas Tuchel says the decision from officials to stop play before his side scored an equaliser against Real Madrid "feels like a betrayal".
articles.title: Thomas Tuchel: Bayern Munich manager says offside decision "feels like a betrayal"

articles.description: Rory McIlroy calls for the split world of professional golf to find "a compromise" that brings a sense of unity.
articles.title: PGA Tour: Rory McIlroy says golf can learn from NI peace process

articles.description: Naomi Osaka beats France's Clara Burel in straight sets in the Italian Open first round on her first appearance at the tournament since 2021.
articles.title: Naomi Osaka marks Italian Open return with victory

articles.description: Former Spanish FA chief, Luis Rubiales is to stand trial for charges of sexual assault and coercion over the unsolicited kiss he gave player, Jenni Hermoso during last year's World Cup win.
articles.title: Luis Rubiales to face trial for sexual assault after World Cup kiss

articles.description: BBC Sport visits Spain to find out why Real Madrid have radically remodelled their iconic Bernabeu stadium, as they aim to stay ahead of the competition in European football.
articles.title: The new Bernabeu: Can Real Madrid's stadium keep them at the top?

articles.description: Ippei Mizuhara agrees to plead guilty to stealing from Japanese baseball star Shohei Ohtani in the US.
articles.title: Ippei Mizuhara: Ohtani's former interpreter to plead guilty to fraud in US

articles.description: Natalie Robyn leaves her position as chief executive officer of motorsport’s governing body the FIA after just 18 months in the role.
articles.title: Formula 1: Natalie Robyn leaves role as FIA chief executive officer after just 18 months

articles.description: Frenchman Benjamin Thomas takes a surprise victory in Lucca on stage five of the Giro d’Italia as Tadej Pogacar retains his overall lead.
articles.title: Giro d'Italia: Cofidis' Benjamin Thomas wins stage five as Tadej Pogacar retains lead
